summary: "City of God" is a 2002 Brazilian crime movie about the rise of organized crime in a Rio de Janeiro suburb from the 1960s to the 1980s. It's based on a real story and a book by Paulo Lins. The film follows a young boy, Li'l ZÃ©, who becomes a drug dealer, and his conflict with a vigilante-turned-criminal, Knockout Ned. The movie was praised by critics and got four Oscar nominations. Many actors were from the favelas, making the story more authentic. It's considered one of the best films of the 21st century.
title: City of God (2002 film)
